results.title: The Climates of North America
results.creator_credit: Tom Daly, ONF | NFB and Joseph Koenig
results.brief_description: The film shows what climate is and how it shapes the vegetation and the life of the inhabitants of North America’s climatic regions - from the North Pole to the Tropic of Cancer.

results.title: The Climate puzzle
results.creator_credit: Gregory Andorfer, National Academy of Sciences (U.S.) and WQED
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Planet earth”.
Scientists tell us that no human beings have ever experienced the earth’s “normal climate”. Civilisation has flourished in a narrow window between vast ice ages. When will climate change again and why? Are we entering a new ice age, or will the current global warming trend from the greenhouse effect, hold off the inevitable?

results.title: The Clerk
results.creator_credit: Morten Parker, Allan Wargon and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Nature of Work”.
This film explores the conflict between what a man (in this case an office clerk) wants from his job and what the company wants from him. It raises the question of how far an industry ought to be expected to go in relieving dull, repetitive work for the sake of employee satisfaction.

results.title: The Cleo Laine collection
results.creator_credit: Bill Ramsey, de Montignie Productions and Graeme Rowland
results.brief_description: Recorded live at the Melbourne Concert Hall in 1986, this video presents the sensuous and sultry jazz and blues singer Cleo Laine performing with her husband John Dankworth and the Dankworth Quartet. British born Cleo Laine began her musical career in the early 1950s where she met and married renowned musician John Dankworth in 1958. Together they have toured the world (and still currently touring) but Cleo has also tried her hand at acting on the stage in such plays as “Flesh to a tiger”, “A Midsummer night’s dream” and the title role in Ibsen’s “Hedda Gabler” among many other performances. Songs from this Melbourne concert by this great lady include “Free and easy”, “I love you just the way you are”, “Crazy rhythm”, “Send in the clowns”, “He was beautiful”.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bill Ramsey, de Montignie Productions and Graeme Rowland

results.title: The Clay circus
results.creator_credit: Texture Films and Herman J. Engel
results.brief_description: Captures, without narration, the spirit of the circus. A clay sculpture, by Shay Rieger, inspired by the color, forms, and motions of the circus, are intercut with segments of actual circus acts.

results.title: The Classroom
results.creator_credit: Patrick Ryan, Eltham Films and Tim Burstall
results.brief_description: Puppet film for children. Sebastian the Fox appears in a typical classroom with children playing pranks on their master as well as on each other. As so often happens the innocent are punished, in this case Sebastian. The offenders are eventually caught and receive their just desserts.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Patrick Ryan, Eltham Films and Tim Burstall

results.title: The Classical idea
results.creator_credit: Bayley Silleck and Educational Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Art of the western world”.
An episode in the comprehensive art history series, “Art of the Western World”, that focuses on the art of the Western classical world. Narrated by Michael Wood, this program focuses on the origins of humanism and classical works of ancient Greece as well as Roman architecture and engineering. Through a discussion of the works in their historical, religious, intellectual and social context, this program provides both a thorough outline of these periods in art history and underlines their relevance to issues outside the parameters of the works themselves.

results.title: The Classic guitar: a miniature orchestra
results.creator_credit: Nina Collier, Lee R. Bobker, Arts and Audiences and Dynamic Films
